name: sys::fd::unix::FileDesc::read_buf

core::io::BorrowedCursor::<'a>::as_mut.doc:
Returns a mutable reference to the whole cursor.

 # Safety

 The caller must not uninitialize any previously initialized bytes.

core::ptr::mut_ptr::<impl *mut T>::cast.doc: Casts to a pointer of another type.

core::io::BorrowedCursor::<'a>::capacity.doc: Returns the available space in the cursor.

sys::pal::unix::cvt.doc:
Converts native return values to Result using the *-1 means error is in `errno`*  convention.
 Non-error values are `Ok`-wrapped.

core::io::BorrowedCursor::<'a>::advance.doc:
Advances the cursor by asserting that `n` bytes have been filled.

 After advancing, the `n` bytes are no longer accessible via the cursor and can only be
 accessed via the underlying buffer. I.e., the buffer's filled portion grows by `n` elements
 and its unfilled portion (and the capacity of this cursor) shrinks by `n` elements.

 # Safety

 The caller must ensure that the first `n` bytes of the cursor have been initialized. `n`
 must not exceed the remaining capacity of this cursor.
